topic.title: Does bitcoinforks.bit resolve for anyone?
topic.body:
I'm having problems it, http://127.0.0.1:43110/bitcoinforks.bit/ gives me:

Not Found

/bitcoinforks.bit/

Other .bit domains resolve for me.
Is is a problem that i didn't specify any "ns" entry in the .bit domains value?

topic.title: URL rewriting from 'it' to 'it/' possible in ZeroNet site?
topic.body:
I am wondering if some URL rewriting possible in ZeroNet site?

My simple static site has localized language subfolders:

it/
de/
es/

I don't have navaids from main page yet, so I ask people to type in the URL with the language-specific suffix.

But if they forget the trailing /  , they get 'page not found'.

Can I somehow rewrite the URL (or is there another simple way to fix this that will reliably work?)

Thanks for any advice!

1_1GzycmSBHvHfdNe1tUQHsDfDEpBgvBatXQ.body:
> [nofish](#comment_724_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): your domain's json is invalid, you can validate it using eg.: https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/

Ok - I tried that, and it said the JSON is valid according to RFC 4627

still confused...

> [nofish](#comment_724_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): your domain's json is invalid, you can validate it using eg.: https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/

ok, i get it, you didn't mean the content.json but the domain. Right, I'll fix that - thanks again!

2_1GzycmSBHvHfdNe1tUQHsDfDEpBgvBatXQ.body:
> [nofish](#comment_731_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): use http://127.0.0.1:43110/yoursite/?es/anything instad of http://127.0.0.1:43110/yoursite/es/anything, and then you can handle the url in javascript

Sweet tip, thanks!
